title: (x) Gladiator logo - Castellar (customized) {Mike Y}
content:
my teenaged daughter wants me to make her a T-shirt with the text GLADIATOR screened..   
   
so this should not be too difficult to ID... huh?   
   
   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144040im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42870.jpg)
author: zpunktled

comments.content:
Jack,   
   
I think the font is [Castellar](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144040/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=202342) (Monotype) that has been filled in. All the letterforms look the same to me, especially the G, T & R.

sorry Yves...   
i axually did a search... but i could not find it..   
   
and it was pretty simply to customize and make bolder with illustrator...   
   
however i still owe Mike a big T H A N X!   
because my teenager wanted it instantly..   
   
   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144040im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42895.jpg)

Thanks Jack. That's a pretty funny-looking 'Font Gladiator'.   
   
Yves, have people been telling us that there was a way to use Google to search the Typophile archives? I tried using the Typophile search and Google and couldn't get any answers, so I sat down with the Font Book until it jumped off the page. The T and R were what I kept looking for.

My name is Maximus Decimus Meridius, comander of the armies of the North, general of the Fleix Legions, loyal servant to the true emperor, Marcus Aurelius......And I will have my vengeance, in this life or the next.

well... if it wasn't for the spectacles...   
   
however.... i would still go and see the movie
Then listen to me. Learn from me. I wasn't the best because I killed quickly. I was the best because the crowed loved me! Win the crowd, and you'll win your freedom.

No prob, you couldn't find it with the Typophile Advanced Search,   
as it's buried amongst the big chunk of archives thaht went AWOHL   
a while ago. I had to search externally to dig this one up.

Well, James, our resident archive meister, taught me this trick: go   
to Google and do an [Advanced Search](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144040/http:/www.google.com/advanced_search?hl=en), where you can restrict   
your finds to a certain domain, in this instance [typophile.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144040/http:/www.google.com/search?as_q=gladiator&num=10&hl=en&ie=ISO-8859-1&btnG=Google%2BSearch&as_epq=&as_oq=&as_eq=&lr=&as_ft=i&as_filetype=&as_qdr=all&as_nlo=&as_nhi=&as_occt=any&as_dt=i&as_sitesearch=typophile.com&safe=images).   
It worked this time.
